intro: Batrachium marinum, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Caribbean and the Gulf of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its waxy, green leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in salty, humid environments and is often found growing along shorelines and in coastal hammocks. Batrachium marinum is also known for its ability to tolerate salt spray and sandy soils, making it an important part of coastal ecosystems.
